title: Factor into Primes
text: Factor each coefficient into primes. A prime number is a counting number greater than $$1$$, whose only factors are $$1$$ and itself. The first few prime numbers are: $$2$$, $$3$$, $$5$$, $$7$$, $$11$$, $$13$$, etc.
speech: Factor each coefficient into primes. A prime number is a counting number greater than  1 , whose only factors are  1  and itself. The first few prime numbers are:  2 ,  3 ,  5 ,  7 ,  11 ,  13 , etc.
pacedSpeech: Factor each coefficient into primes. A prime number is a counting number greater than   1
and itself. The first few prime numbers are:   2

title: Identify Common Factors in each Column
text: $$48=2\times2\times2 3\times2$$\n$$80=2\times2\times2 5\times2$$\n$$2$$, $$2$$, $$2$$, and $$2$$ are shared by both numbers.
speech: 48 is equal to 2 times 2 times 2 3 times 2 \n 80 is equal to 2 times 2 times 2 5 times 2 \n 2 ,  2 ,  2 , and  2  are shared by both numbers.
